title: wasm_import_module does not allow empty module name
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried compiling the following code to WASM using `cargo wasi build --release --target wasm32-unknown-unknown`.
```rust
#[link(wasm_import_module = "")]
extern "C" {
    pub fn hello();
}

#[no_mangle]
pub extern "C" fn run() {
    unsafe {
        hello();
    }
}
```

I expected to see the following output:
```wat
(module
  (type $t0 (func))
  (import "" "hello" (func $hello_world::hello::h0833d2bcb995432f (type $t0))) ;; Notice it imports "" "hello"
  (func $run (export "run") (type $t0)
    (call $hello_world::hello::h0833d2bcb995432f))
  (memory $memory (export "memory") 16)
  (global $__data_end (export "__data_end") i32 (i32.const 1048576))
  (global $__heap_base (export "__heap_base") i32 (i32.const 1048576)))
```

Instead, this this is the output I get:
```wat
(module
  (type $t0 (func))
  (import "env" "hello" (func $hello_world::hello::h0833d2bcb995432f (type $t0))) ;; Notice it imports "env" "hello"
  (func $run (export "run") (type $t0)
    (call $hello_world::hello::h0833d2bcb995432f))
  (memory $memory (export "memory") 16)
  (global $__data_end (export "__data_end") i32 (i32.const 1048576))
  (global $__heap_base (export "__heap_base") i32 (i32.const 1048576)))
```

I need it to import "hello" from "", to be compatible with a pre-existing API that puts functions in global space. Attempting to run the code in wasmtime when importing from "env" causes a loading error.

### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.66.0 (69f9c33d7 2022-12-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 69f9c33d71c871fc16ac445211281c6e7a340943
commit-date: 2022-12-12
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.66.0
LLVM version: 15.0.2
```
